New Records: Sri Lanka bowled out for their lowest-ever total in T20I history, scoring just 77 runs against South Africa.
This total was Sri Lanka's worst in a T20 World Cup match since being bowled out for 87 runs by Australia in the 2010 T20 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Anrich Nortje's standout performance led the South African bowling attack in a one-sided match.
Sri Lanka managed just three fours and three sixes in 19.1 overs.
Keshav Maharaj's two wickets in consecutive balls further dismantled the Sri Lankan batting lineup.
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka's performance was far from the level expected in such a critical match.
The team's inability to build partnerships or counter the South African bowlers' tactics was evident.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The New York pitch, being used for the first time in this tournament, proved challenging for the batsmen.
The expansive outfield added to the batting side's woes, with boundaries hard to come by.
Others: Sri Lanka's batting lineup collapsed for a record low in T20I history, scoring just 77 runs against South Africa.
